randgeo v0.3.1.91

Introduction to the randgeo package

Scott Chamberlain, Noam Ross, and Samuel Bosch

2021-03-07

Source: vignettes/randgeo.Rmd
randgeo.Rmd

randgeo is a no dependency R package for generating random lat/long positions, or random WKT or GeoJSON points or polygons.

The benefit of no dependencies is that it can easily be used in other packages without any pain. e.g., you may want to show examples in your package but you don’t want a heavy dependency just for examples.

This package is adapted from Javascript’s https://github.com/tmcw/geojson-random but with modifications.

Install

Stable randgeo version from CRAN

install.packages("randgeo")

Or, the development version from Github

devtools::install_github("ropensci/randgeo")
library("randgeo")

random position

rg_position()
#> [[1]]
#> [1] -6.856416 -5.597165

Many positions

rg_position(10)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] -20.54123 -14.41973
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1]  48.48756 -19.02854
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] -55.16948 -58.91682
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] 58.70942 13.24842
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1] -92.75535 -33.74816
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> [1] -19.42471 -42.06657
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> [1] -169.657287   -7.864087
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> [1] 157.48046 -31.98288
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> [1] 123.10718  65.40137
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> [1] -156.16730   -3.77273

Random position within a bounding box

rg_position(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 52.18506 59.06639

Well-known text

random points

A single point

wkt_point()
#> [1] "POINT (-9.9420534 -11.3522573)"

Many points

wkt_point(count = 10)
#>  [1] "POINT (35.5490075 -0.3067286)"   "POINT (16.0272552 22.8142091)"  
#>  [3] "POINT (-121.7011776 8.8676675)"  "POINT (125.3776923 -37.8191860)"
#>  [5] "POINT (-84.5683530 -28.2834666)" "POINT (-8.2347751 12.7270824)"  
#>  [7] "POINT (-55.7389456 66.2374459)"  "POINT (113.5214497 36.0243241)" 
#>  [9] "POINT (67.3110628 -13.7432522)"  "POINT (64.0184114 -22.7319574)"

Within a bounding box

wkt_point(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> [1] "POINT (50.5095993 55.4325855)"

The fmt parameter controls how many decimal points

wkt_point()
#> [1] "POINT (-77.4836529 -71.5048811)"
wkt_point(fmt = 10)
#> [1] "POINT (-151.3944394235 -40.7846001950)"

random polygons

wkt_polygon()
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-172.4395734 44.3536654, -173.5508959 39.3268025, -164.9948949 41.7372113, -172.9741448 38.6729608, -175.1123075 33.2022466, -177.3429808 34.6810034, -177.1167776 35.8867407, -177.8723720 37.7739950, 179.6991792 42.8737391, -176.4340515 38.3690478, -172.4395734 44.3536654))"

Adjust number of vertices (Default: 10)

wkt_polygon(num_vertices = 4)
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-162.7375428 8.5684197, -158.4934141 -7.6384761, -169.8198118 -1.8711026, -167.2081363 5.5600057, -162.7375428 8.5684197))"

Adjust maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon (Default: 10)

wkt_polygon(max_radial_length = 5)
#> [1] "POLYGON ((89.8836295 -1.6356181, 89.7356198 -3.5217564, 89.5350970 -4.3749532, 91.8337826 -3.9133948, 93.5577035 -5.1655345, 93.4276177 -7.2145645, 89.2583394 -8.9119749, 87.1156252 -6.5311760, 88.0814987 -2.4065516, 89.3198265 -0.6428110, 89.8836295 -1.6356181))"

Within a bounding box

wkt_polygon(bbox = c(-130, 50, -120, 60))
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-125.2650642 55.0156490, -120.1023770 62.1097250, -123.1095602 54.3863953, -124.9884765 53.8390178, -113.1961364 48.9004932, -127.5155137 53.3103902, -137.7417925 52.7855552, -129.0976589 54.2346849, -133.0504021 56.4809005, -126.3863702 54.8661666, -125.2650642 55.0156490))"

GeoJSON

random points

A single point

geo_point()
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 139.644374   9.129964
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> NULL
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geo_list"

Many points

geo_point(count = 10)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
...

Within a bounding box

geo_point(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 57.76841 57.49322
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> NULL
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geo_list"

random polygons

geo_polygon()
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#> [1] 135.29047  82.77313
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] 125.9521  80.1049
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[3]]
#> [1] 146.22881  80.07864
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[4]]
#> [1] 121.73018  74.89923
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[5]]
#> [1] 116.31064  74.68384
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[6]]
#> [1] 105.73521  73.11728
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[7]]
#> [1] 87.21678 73.91170
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[8]]
#> [1] 104.59545  75.76564
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[9]]

#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[10]]

Adjust number of vertices (Default: 10)

geo_polygon(num_vertices = 4)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]

#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#>

#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#> [1] -150.077304    2.695042
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] -151.466911    3.391995
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[3]]
#> [1] -151.570959    4.208612
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[4]]
#> [1] -152.549809    7.577031
#>

Adjust maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon (Default: 10)
